context.p: You can insert a reference to an external entity which is not yet declared in the current document.

step.cmd: Select an external entity not yet declared in the document.

substep.cmd: Select the Insert From File radio button.
Specify the name of the entity.

info.p: In the Entity Name field, enter the name of the external entity.

note.p: The name of the entity must be unique within the internal DTD subset.

substep.cmd: Specify the filename of the entity.

info.p: In the File Name field, enter the filename of the external entity. You can use the Browse button to browse for the file.

fig.title: Not declared external entity selected for insertion from a file.

info.p: To insert the reference to the specified external entity, click OK.

stepresult.p: The external entity will be declared in the document and the external entity reference will be inserted.

fig.title: External entity reference inserted in the document.

stepresult.p: You can also convert the document portion from the external entity into a regular content, change the external entity declaration or remove the external entity declaration.
